title: New Honour System Feedback
body:
Gotta hand it to Riot on this one, since the release of the new honour system I've seen a massive decrease in toxicity.

I'll admit I was skeptical at first, but I've even found myself being less toxic in games due to hunting for those delicious honours. I've found myself tilting less, and getting an honour at the end of the game actually feels good now, like someone actually noticed what you did. I haven't even received any rewards or anything from the new system but it's making me fall back in love with LoL, with the lack of toxicity in the community. I'd say I've probably had less than 1/10 of the old level of toxic people and flamers, and you actually form an (albeit temporary) relationship with your team mates.

This is a great new update in my opinion, and I just wanted to say thanks!

replies.body:
I agree with this. I've had less toxic people in games. I even had the typical 0/12 support with an adc who was playing ranked for the first time (and had gotten to level 30 just by playing beginner bots) and a top who stood afk under her tower for 4 mins before quitting, but instead of the rest of the team flaming, someone made the call to protect our Master Yi mid and hold out to late game.

If it weren't for this honour system, everybody would have been toxic and we would have lost. Instead, we joined together and focused on protecting our hard-carry at all costs, and ended up winning.

Just goes to show what a postive mindset can achieve :D
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

The new honour system SUCKS! How am I supposed to honour clutch plays by players on the other team? What happens if everyone on my team (myself included) has a shit game? The old honour system was great. The new one sucks.

> How am I supposed to honour clutch plays by players on the other team?

Riot have plans to add honours for opponents, it's just not available yet as Riot are trying to make sure everything is working smoothly as is (I'll see if I can find a Rioter comment on this).
EDIT: I've found the post I was thinking of (found [here](https://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/E9KeXM5E-runes-reformed-discussion?comment=00020000), in the "Runes Reforged" discussion that recently appeared on the boards). It's Marauder quoting NaKyle, who goes on to say that Riot is "trying to nail the right vibe for teammates" and that "We've [Riot] got post-launch updates planned to bring back a way to shout out a player from the opposing team."

> What happens if everyone on my team (myself included) has a shit game? 

There is a small circular button with a right facing arrow underneath the honours that you can use to skip honours if you feel no one is deserving in a given match. No one is forcing you to give out honours, it is completely voluntary.

I would just add to this that remember Honor is not about playing well from a skill stand point. Honor is all about being sportsmanlike and having a good attitude. It's meant to be a call out to people who are mentally resilient and stay focused on the game regardless of their actual performance. 

Thats why the categories are 

tilt proof (for someone who's maybe had a bad start but pulled through in the end)
Great shot caller (for someone who rallied the team and focused them on the game at hand)
GG ( for players who were generally a pleasure to play with)

I know they will always be related (attitude and actual performance) but Honor is meant to focus more on the attitude side than performance.
I also wish we had a view of when we will lvl up our honour rank, I had 3 ranked games in a row when I got Majority and lobby notification and I am still lvl 2

Two points on this.

Firstly, the Honour system is about *consistency*, not necessarily quantity. Getting lots of honours in only a few games will certainly help you level up faster, but you still need to show some consistency in order to actually level up. That doesn't mean you *have* to keep earning honours every game, though.

The Honour FAQ covers this:
> **Do I need to do anything special to progress?**
> Honor levels are all about consistency. Just show up, don't be an asshole, and you'll rise over the coming weeks and months. We have different rewards and celebrations prepared for players who are highly honored in specific games or over the course of a season.
> 
> **If I get no Honors, do I still level up?**
> You will, just a little more slowly than those who rack them up like crazy.

Secondly, as for "having a view of when you next level up" (or, more simply, a "progress bar"), it makes sense that Riot didn't include this, as it would make the system abuse-able by those who want to be toxic yet still want to receive rewards. They could simply change their behaviour whenever they come to close to losing a level. It sucks not being able to track your progress, I agree, but it's better for the community without any kind of progress tracking.

It's a good system but I think honour level of players should be viewable at champion selection, I don't really want to play with anyone who's honor 0, I have met a few and definitely not the type you want to have in a game. I would rather dodge.

I dont think we need to have a progression bar like what most people, otherwise people will just treat honour level as another meta game than actually caring about behaviour.
Although there is a decrease in toxicity, premades just honour each other, it seems like i never get honoured if there's a premade in the game, even if i carry.
This. Played yesterday with a 3 man and me and the other solo played so hard and kept us in the game while the premade all fed and they honored the teemo supp who was like 0/5...

It certainly seems like a great addition. I haven't played much since the patch came live, but what I have played has been noticeably more positive. It's good to see the community trying to be better, even if it is just under the condition of being rewarded.

That said, I've not used it much myself. I find myself racking my brain after each match trying to figure out who (if anyone) I should honour, and most of the time I just haven't thought anyone "stuck out" enough for it. Maybe it will be a bit different as I continue to play, or maybe I just don't pay that much attention to what's going on most of the time. Either way, I get the feeling there's a lot of other players who are in the same boat, which isn't the best for the system to reach it's full potential.

Honestly, I hate it. The old one was absolutely useless, and this one brings certain rewards which is good... But I've played several games now with it where I've wanted to honour several players, either on my team or the enemy.. And instead I can only honour a single person. And I'm forced to do it.

This needs to change, that's all I can say.
